author: A_Brickset_user
title: Minis Are Amazing!
review:
This is a huge mini. It is nearly three times larger than the Podracer mini, Anakin's Pod.
The colors are true to the film, however it doesn't open to "deploy" battle droids.
On the bottom are those pieces that are round on the bottom, giving it a floating look. 
All in all, a great set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Sweet, but weres the AAT?????
review: really cool! but what bugs me the most is that Lego never made any sets to go with this one not even an AAT. the MTT looks really good, franclly better then the large verson. It is really detailed too.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Wicked
review: This set is big for a mini but it is great. You can play with it anywhere and it has a better colour scheme then the large one. There is only one problem. It is cool but it lacks in detail and I think it would have been cooler if lego made a mini droid rack to go inside it.But don't let what I wrote stop you buyingthis set it is great fun to build and play with.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Trade Federation Multi-Troop-Transport!!!
review: This is one of my favorite ships! I like the Episode 1 trade federation, so this is a natural get for me! It has the forward blasters for sure, and it uses the good color scheme to capture alot of detail, and it is blocky- just like the real multi troop transport! These things are so robust, I make it challenge the AT-TE mini model! A fun set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great mini
review: The MTT isn't my favorite Starwars vehicle, but I still love this set. It is a joy to build, doesn't break apart easily, and looks just like the one in the movies. It's sitting in the front row of my mini models collection.

author: reidak49
title: activate the droids
review: i rember episode 1 when the mtts deployed the droid army this little set was accurate and tough it also had parts for a mini y wing fighter but not all of them this is one of the best minis to bad i took the mtt apart

author: Manxboi24
title: Good set
review:
Well, as the title says, it is a good set. It isn't very breakable unlike dome of the other mini sets. It is also pretty accurate to the bigger sets but the circle bit at the front doesn't open, like the bigger sets. One of the main cons of this set is that there are no other mini sets from the Battle of Naboo such as a mini AAT. 
      
Overall :

Plus :
* pretty accurate in appearance
* easy to build
* isn't very breakable

Minus:
* circle bit at the front doesn't open
* no other mini sets from the Battle of Naboo

Overall, I'd give it 6/10

author: Ovid07
title: I Finally Found Another Star Wars Mini To Review! ! !
review:
I'm so happy to have finally found another mini to review!  I don't own this set, but before you all get mad at me, I want you to know one of my friends has it.  So... Ha!

PROS
Looks like a MTT.
No annoying decals.
Correct colors

CONS
None of the second seris of minis are in scale with each otther.

OVERALL
Minis- Gotta' Get Them All!

author: Leggodt94
title: I guess in this case MTT really stands for Mini Troop Transport
review: Intrepretating my favorite lego set of all, the mini MTT is a must have for droid fans. It has a lot of detail and has features like bending guns and flap in the back. So with this set, all you have to do is "Activate the Droids!".

author: Matt_Vader
title: Can't afford the big version?
review:
The mini MTT is a good set if you don't have the big version (like me). If you have the big version it is a waste of money for what it is.

On to the pros and the cons:-

 

Pros:

Easy to store

Cheap

Good substitute for big version

 

Cons:

No minifigs

No point of getting it if you have the big version

 

Minifigs:

None

 

Summary:

Get if you don't have the big version

 

Rating out of 10:

7.5/10

author: Doek5554
title: Like his Daddy.
review: This was a cute little set and it looked just like it father, the bigger MTT. There is a little compartment in the back that could hold about one to two studs. It moves smoothy on the floor or carpet with the circles on the bottom.  I wasn't that much of a use for us, but it was fun for a little while.

author: Kalhiki
title: And Here We have a Block
review:
Fine, not completely a block, but it is block-like. It has the basic shape of an MTT, but the lack of detail really marks this set down. It has the smooth/round pieces on the bottom to roll it easily across the floor. The back does have the feature of opening, but mine kinda fell apart (fine, it holds together well and I pulled it apart, so what?) and I don't know the correct way it opens, but trust me it opens. The front, sadly, doesn't open, but it's a mini! You can't have everything. It also has the guns on the front, but no big deal.

Overall a good set though the lack of detail does mark it down. But if you don't care about that, then it's fine.

author: nasalegojedi
title: A Nice Little Set
review:
I got this a few years ago, and the set is still a delight to build.

Pros: Easy build
Slides along carpet
Small and Sturdy
Very Well detailed
A number of pieces (nearly 100) for a small price

Cons
None!


It is a great little set!

author: AETerry
title: MTT Miniset Review
review:
The big draw for me with these mini sets is their pricing and the ability to get several of these sets and create models based on ships from Star Wars without having to spend a lot of money.

 

The detail is fairly solid for a miniset and even after having been tossed into a box for storage & moving, I found that it has held together very well and not fallen apart.

 

So while I'm not a huge Star Wars fan, there have been sets and models like this one that I've enjoyed very much so in picking up for display.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - MTT Review
review:
This is the 4th and last set you need to collect if you want to build the mini y-wing which you can build after you got all 4 mini Star Wars sets you need. The build of this set is very easy and there're also no stickers to worry about. It's a good set for army building and it's also a good set if you want to make a MOC (My own creation) and/or a brickfilm in the future. I can't complain much about it and it's a great little model to have for sure.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Review

author: United_Bricks
title: 4491: MTT Mini Review.
review:
The Mini MTT is a great little set, sure its not packed full of detail but's its a mini so what do you expect. Building takes very few time and once built it looks good. The set probably ins't really good in play-ability wise so its more for collectors. The overall size of it surprised me as I didn't expect it to be as big as it is. The parts are  actually quite good some rare dark orange parts and a nice selection of brown parts.  

Overall it would make a good stocking filler for older kids and comes with a nice selection of parts.
